intro: Eriocaulon schweickerdtii, commonly known as the white sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant is characterized by its grass-like appearance, with narrow, linear leaves and small, clustered flowers. It typically grows in wet or marshy habitats, thriving in environments with consistent moisture. Its botanical features make it an important component of wetland ecosystems.
